alert.note: Alert for Hendry; Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Collier and southwestern Hendry Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ave Maria, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ave Maria, Immokalee, Golden Gate Estates, Felda, Big Corkscrew Island, Orangetree, Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Bunker Hill and Lake Trafford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
